result.execSummary:
The defendant Norman S Albert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Norman S Albert

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Norman S Albert in court.  Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson in court for Norman S Albert.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant plead guilty to count #2 and #3. Upon motion of the State count #1 dismissed and read-in. Motion granted. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Defendant does not make statement. Court gives warning to deportation. Court sentences defendant. Minutes filed.
Status conference on October 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

9:21 AM Case called. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Norman S Albert in court.  Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson in court for Norman S Albert. 
Atty Albert states there is resolution and asks for another status for CS to be completed. 
No victims present. 
Case will need to be reassigned, hearing set in 60 days.

Defendant Norman S Albert in court.  Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson in court for Norman S Albert. Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Norman S Albert in court.  Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson in court for Norman S Albert. Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is doing treatment. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH GRAND GENEVA.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-01 thru 22-03
